entry.title: come when you call
entry.summary:
Author: kryptonian

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,593Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: Eddie answers on the third ring. ‚ÄúBuck?‚Äù His voice is rough with sleep, low and gravelly. ‚ÄúDo you know what time it is?‚Äù Buck tries to lift his phone to his mouth, but the motion of his shoulder curling forward shifts his wing again, the tip of one brushing against the sheets. They‚Äôre huge. Bigger than he can process. He still can‚Äôt make himself look. The only thing that escapes him is a soft, pained whimper. Eddie suddenly seems a lot less tired. His voice sharpens instantly. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs going on? Are you hurt?‚Äù Another whine tears from Buck as the pain flares, muscles along the top of the wings tensing, fluttering behind him. He can see their span now, crowding the edges of his vision‚Äîand somehow, it feels like they‚Äôre still growing. ‚ÄúE-Eddie,‚Äù he chokes out. ‚ÄúI-I don‚Äôt know. There‚Äôs so much blood.‚ÄùOR Buck wakes up with wings tearing themselves out of him. Eddie soothes the pain.

entry.title: Take My Defenses
entry.summary:
Author: Hawkbooty

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 527,895Chapters: 56/?Kudos: 198

Summary: Edmundo "Eddie" Diaz had yet to carve out a reputation in the NHL as a Third-Line Center for the Dallas Stars, but this season was different. As he approached the milestone of a possible 20-goal season, and several star players on the roster were sidelined due to various injuries, the coaching staff chose Eddie to wear the iconic Victory Green of the Stars for this year's All-Star Game.Evan ‚ÄúBuck‚Äù Buckley, a star of the Los Angeles Kings, his image as a golden boy often shone brightly, but it was clouded recently by the lingering controversy stemming from his off-ice antics; clumsy mistakes had thrust him into the spotlight for all the wrong reasons. Now, as he prepared for the upcoming festivities of the All-Star Game, his Captain, Howard ‚ÄúChimney‚Äù Han‚Äîwho also happened to be his line partner and brother-in-law‚Äîhad been entrusted to be his chaperone; this came with the privilege of sleeping in the room adjacent to his, the two spaces connected by a door.It‚Äôs uncertain what the future has in store for Buck and Eddie. Whether it involves personal growth or overcoming obstacles, only time will tell.‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨‚ñ¨Just Another 911 Hockey AU

entry.title: Sleeping to the Sound of Rainfall, Right Next to You
entry.summary:
Author: Beguiling_Soliloquy

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,056Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 22

Summary: Eddie has been dancing around his feelings for Buck for who knows how long. Sometimes he feels like they‚Äôve always been there. Sometimes he thinks they‚Äôll never leave. He doesn't know how long they've really been there, some days he think's they've always been there, ever since that man got a grenade stuck in his leg. He's not sure exactly what to do with these feelings and if he should tell Buck at all, and for the first time in who knows how long, it's raining again in LA. and Eddie in fact, does not have an umbrella, and he didn't check the weather.So, what is Eddie going to do when Buck decides to be reckless again after he had just lost his Abuela, and is still mourning the loss of his former Captain?OR: Eddie Diaz is a gay mess, and Buck being reckless is not helping.

entry.title: get out!
entry.summary:
Author: kryptonian

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 9,589Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 127

Summary: When they make it back to the station, Eddie expects things to go back to normal. Clearly, he imagined something, his own guilt transpiring into something edging toward an auditory hallucination. He pushes on, shedding his gear and making his way into the kitchen. He chops up the vegetables handed to him, slicing them finely, long fingers careful with the blade, well, until‚Äî I don‚Äôt even know how to stop staring. God, his hands. Holy shit. I wonder how many of his fingers would fit in my mouth‚Äî ‚ÄúJesus Christ,‚Äù Eddie chokes, knife slipping in his hand, almost nicking his finger. He pauses, placing the knife to the side of the chopping board. ‚ÄúWhat did you‚Äîwhat was that?‚ÄùBuck looks up from where he‚Äôd been staring at Eddie‚Äôs hands, catching his eye. ‚ÄúHuh?‚Äù His eyes are beautiful, Buck says‚Äîor his voice does. Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 29,132Chapters: 14/15Kudos: 419

Summary: Escaping the Buckleys was easy. Finding love fell into his lap one night in Miami. Evan Buckley thought his life was made when he had met Annette. The two married within months of meeting, living happily, and expecting their first child together. Tragedy strikes when Annette passes away during the birth. Evan leaves their home with his son. Getting knocked down by a car wasn't exactly how he thought the next step in his life would go.

entry.title: Your Chains are Forged
entry.summary:
Author: blackrose_17

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,349Chapters: 2/6Kudos: 45

Summary: Edumndo paid no attention to them as he looked out the window up towards the moon, where he could see a thin veil that connected the world of the living and the dead. ‚ÄúTonight is a night of magic. Where those gone may visit their loved ones. And for those who are in endless torment, try and do good to remove a chain or two.‚Äù Edmundo turned to look at them. ‚ÄúThey always fail.‚Äù Climbing to his feet, he approached his son and daughter-in-law. ‚ÄúTonight you will be visited by three ghosts. Christopher is in El Paso, and Helena believes she has won, but the spirits that appear at Christmas will not let her win. It is time for the Diaz parents to either change or keep forging the chains they have already made.

entry.title: Piece By Piece (English Version)
entry.summary:
Author: Pookiebrin

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 34,627Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 426

Summary: Buck had finally understood... it had taken him 3 months, 3 months of silences and angry looks, of orders given coldly and endless lists of tasks at the station, of people leaving when he sat down at the table, of conversations stopping when he arrived.3 months but he had finally understood: Station 118 did not forgive and those he had fought for had turned their backs on him.3 months but it had become clear to him: he was not welcome there and that was not his family, it never had been. And now all that was left was to let go. But a call and a girl who reminds him too much of himself could be the solution to the cold in his life and his heart.

entry.title: [PODFIC] The Mortifying Ordeal Of Being Known by Polish_Amber
entry.summary:
Author: RockStar03

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 304Chapters: 6/7Kudos: 51

Summary: The thing was, the 118 was full of gossips. Eddie had been at the station less than a week before Hen and Chim wrangled details about his ‚Äúhot young thing‚Äù from him (‚ÄúBuck is only 4 years younger than me, he is not a ‚Äòhot young thing‚Äô!‚Äù Eddie complained.) And Bobby was open about his worries for his son‚Äôs lack of direction and the secrets he appears to be keeping (‚ÄúI just wish I could help Evan find the thing that gives him purpose,‚Äù Bobby lamented.) It just made it all the more ridiculous (and horrifying) when Eddie realizes he‚Äôs been dating his Captain‚Äôs son this whole time (‚ÄúDefiling his baby,‚Äù Chimney cackled, because he clearly wanted Eddie murdered.)--Or, the AU where miscommunication abounds as Eddie seeks advice about his new relationship, Bobby despairs over his adopted son's career prospects and his refusal to talk about it, and Evan Buckley-Nash juggles training at the fire academy, building a family with his new boyfriend, and trying to work out how to tell his overprotective dad that he's already chosen the life he wants, actually. It takes a goddamn tsunami, of all things, to get the story straight.
